channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Students Find New Evidence of the Impossibility of Complete Disorder
item.description: A new mathematic proof marks the first progress in decades on a problem about how order emerges.

item.title: Bolt reportedly threatens legal action against Silverbear Capital
item.description: In the latest twist in Bolt’s aggressive fundraising efforts, the fintech company’s CEO appears to have made a veiled threat of legal action against S...

item.title: Intex PureSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Reviewed: Bubbles on a Budget
item.description: This hot tub is a cheap and easy way to relax—but it still requires a commitment.

item.title: Bluesky tops app charts and sees ‘all-time-highs’ after Brazil bans X
item.description: A Brazilian court’s decision to ban X (formerly Twitter) seems to be benefiting its rivals, especially Bluesky. The microblogging platform announced l...

item.title: Shokz OpenRun Pro 2 Review: Air and Bone Conduction Technology
item.description: The latest workout headphones from Shokz outruns the competition with bigger sound and better battery.

item.title: Is OpenAI worth $100B?
item.description: OpenAI could reportedly increase its valuation to $100 billion. Nvidia and Apple are apparently in talks to contribute to the company’s next fundraisi...

item.title: 21 Best Portable Battery Chargers (2024): For Phones, iPads, Laptops, and Apple Watch
item.description: Keep your phone, tablet, laptop, and other electronics running with these handheld power banks.

item.title: Amazon hires the founders of AI robotics startup Covariant
item.description: Amazon announced Friday evening that it has hired Covariant’s founders — Pieter Abbeel, Peter Chen, and Rocky Duan — along with “about a quarter” of t...

item.title: The Best Invisible Hearing Aids to Keep Your Hearing Loss Private (2024)
item.description: These subtle WIRED-tested and audiologist-recommended devices help wearers keep their hearing loss to themselves.

item.title: Grammy CEO says music industry also has AI concerns
item.description: The rise of AI has consumed the arts, just as it has Silicon Valley. Everyone is pondering: Will AI replace me? © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved...
